Customer Service Officer Job at Critters Veterinary Centre




        
    

        
        Critters Veterinary Centre is a foremost veterinary centre of experienced professionals who provide diagnosis, treatment, x-ray, grooming and boarding services. We continually improve our system in order to provide exceptional services to our Pawrents who entrust the health and care of their pets to us.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Customer Service Officer
Job Location: Lagos

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The ideal candidate will manage all customer's requests for services and products offered in the organization, enlighten clients on features and benefits of goods or services to be purchased, and deliver excellent customer experience.


Responsibilities


	Respond to customer inquiries in a prompt and courteous manner.
	Provide relevant benefits and features of products and services offered.
	Documenting accurately all customer information on organization software.
	Process orders efficiently and accurately.
	Providing timely and consistent feedback to customers.
	Soliciting and resolving customer complaints within the defined resolution timeframe.
	Upselling and cross-selling to clients on products and services.
	Maintain a clean ambiance of the working station and environment.
	Maintain a positive and professional demeanour at all times when interacting with clients, colleagues, and third parties.


Requirements


	Minimum of B.Sc Degree / HND qualification in any field of study.
	Minimum of two (2) years of experience as a customer support or marketing officer.
	Excellent communication, reporting, and interpersonal skills.
	Active listening skills.
	Must be comfortable with pets (dogs & cats).
	Soft Skills Requirement.
	Emotional Intelligence.
	Team player.
	Prmoximity to Lekki is an advantage.


Gross Salary
N200,000 / Month.

Note: Only qualified candidates will be contacted.

We have over the years, evolved into a major player in the Healthcare Industry with business footprints spanning Pharmaceutical Wholesaling, Medical Device Marketing, Pharma Sales and Marketing and Consulting. Our business though based in Plot 29 Ilupeju Industrial Avenue, Ilupeju. title: Job Openings at Digitvant Microfinance Bank
content:
Digitvant Microfinance Bank - We offer a comprehensive digital banking experience, featuring savings, loans, fund transfers, and online payments via our website and App. Our platform allows customers to manage their finances efficiently and access a wide range of personalised services to meet evolving needs.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Credit Analyst

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry: Microfinance / Fintech

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Credit Analyst will be responsible for evaluating credit data, assessing the creditworthiness of potential and existing clients, and making recommendations to support sound lending decisions.
	The ideal candidate will have strong analytical skills, a keen eye for detail, and experience in credit risk assessment.


Key Responsibilities


	Conduct thorough analysis of financial statements, credit reports, and other relevant data to assess risk.
	Review loan applications to determine eligibility and repayment potential.
	Recommend loan terms based on risk assessment.
	Monitor existing credit accounts to identify early warning signs of potential default.
	Prepare detailed credit reports and present findings to Management.
	Ensure compliance with company policies, regulatory requirements, and industry best practices.
	Collaborate with the recovery team to manage delinquent accounts.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Banking and Finance, Economics, or a related field.
	Minimum of 3 years of experience in credit analysis, preferably in a banking, fintech, or microfinance setting.
	Strong knowledge of credit risk principles, lending regulations, and financial analysis.
	Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making skills.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and financial modeling tools.
	Strong attention to detail and accuracy.
	Good communication and report-writing skills.


Application Closing Date: 5th December, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Applications to: b.owoyemi@digitvant.com and copy: hr@digitvant.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

2.) Driver

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Driver will be responsible for conveying staff, operating company vehicle safely and maintaining it in good condition.


Key Responsibilities


	Safely drive company staff to designated locations.
	Adhere to all traffic laws and company driving policies.
	Keep vehicles clean, fueled, and properly maintained at all times.
	Perform routine checks on the vehicle and report any mechanical issues promptly.
	Maintain accurate trip and mileage records.
	Assist with loading and unloading of goods as required.


Requirements


	Minimum of SSCE (Senior Secondary School Certificate).
	At least 5 years of proven driving experience, preferably in a corporate setting.
	Valid driver’s license, Valid LASDRI and a clean driving record.
	Good knowledge of road safety regulations and city routes.
	Punctual, disciplined, and respectful.
	Ability to work flexible hours when required.


Application Closing Date: 30th December, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: b.owoyemi@digitvant.com using the Job Posiiton as the subject of the email.

 

 

3.) Wealth Manager

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

About the role


	We are seeking a highly skilled and client focused Wealth Manager to join our team.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for providing personalized financial advisory services, managing investment portfolios, and building long-term relationships with high net-worth and emerging affluent clients.
	This role requires strong analytical abilities, excellent communication skills, and a deep understanding of financial markets and wealth creation strategies.


Key Responsibilities


	Identify, onboard, and manage high net-worth and emerging affluent clients.
	Provide expert financial advisory and develop customized wealth management plans.
	Conduct comprehensive financial needs assessments for clients.
	Manage and monitor client investment portfolios to ensure alignment with financial goals.
	Achieve individual and team sales targets, including revenue goals.
	Recommend suitable investment products, insurance solutions, and wealth building opportunities.
	Build and maintain strong client relationships through regular reviews and communication.
	Stay updated on market trends, investment products, and regulatory changes.
	Collaborate with internal teams (Risk, Compliance, etc) to ensure quality service delivery.
	Prepare reports, proposals, and presentations for clients and management.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Finance, Economics, Accounting, or any related field (Master’s or MBA is an advantage).
	Minimum of 3 – 5 years of experience in wealth management, investment advisory, private banking, or related fields.
	Professional certifications such as CFA, ACCA, ICAN, CWM, or similar are an added advantage.
	Strong understanding of financial instruments, investment strategies, and market dynamics.
	Excellent analytical, communication, and interpersonal skills.
	Proven track record of managing client portfolios and meeting sales targets.
	High level of integrity, professionalism, and client-centric attitude.


Application Closing Date: 30th December, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover letter to: b.owoyemi@digitvant.com and hr@digitvant.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
